result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevail C Drain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court waives all non-mandatory and mandatory costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Defendant to provide DNA specimen (if haven't already been taken) and pay the DNA surcharge in 12 months or civil judgment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Court waived all non-mandatory and mandatory costs except DNA surcharge due to inability to pay.
Provide DNA specimen and pay DNA surcharge within 12 months or civil judgment.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC during the term of probation or civil judgment.
Obtain full time employment or attend school.
No contact or possession of with firearms.
Comply with any recommended treatment or counseling determined by the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevail C Drain

records.addlTxt:
SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: -   COURT ORDERED: 
Defendant to serve  84 DAYS  in the House of Correction, with  84 DAYS of pretrial incarceration Credit.  
Court ordered a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court waives all non mandatory and mandatory costs, fees and surcharges  due to the inability to pay.
Defendant to provide DNA  specimen ( if haven't already been taken )  and pay the DNA surcharge in 12 Mopnths or  Civil Judgment.
Appellate rights given.




AS TO COUNT 2: COURT ORDERED 
Defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in  the House of Correction with  Zero days f pretrial incarceration credit.   
Court  IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.
    
10 Days of Condition Time ( Straight time) .  
Court waived all non mandatory and mandatory  Costs  except DNA surcharge due to inability to pay. 
Provide DNA specimen  and Pay DNA surcharge within 12 months or Civil Judgment. 
Pay all Supervision fees as determined by the DOC during the term of probation or Civil Judgment.
Comply  with  any recommended treatment or counseling determined  by the agent..
No contact or possession of with Firearms 
Obtain Full Time employment or attend school. 
Appellate Rights given

Defendant Trevail C Drain in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Trevail C Drain in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to have an in person hearing and proceeds Remotely. 


AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. 
Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 



AS TO COUNT 2

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. 
Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Trevail C Drain not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court on defense motion to modify bail. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Bailbond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court DENIED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
Defense request a plea and sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Trevail C Drain in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Trevail C Drain in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court on defense motion to modify bail. 
Bailbond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court Reserved ruling on  defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
Court ordered matter adjourned. This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD.  Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Defendant in custody. Defense counsel recently appointed and currently out of town.
Defense counsel per telephone requesting a bailbond hearing. State notified of defense request for a bail hearing. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Trevail C Drain in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Trevail C Drain in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
